bills.title: To repeal certain provisions of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act and revive the separation between commercial banking and the securities business, in the manner provided in the Banking Act of 1933, the so-called 'Glass-Steagall Act', and for other purposes.
bills.latest_major_action: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.

bills.title: To place a moratorium on permitting for mountaintop removal coal mining until health studies are conducted by the Department of Health and Human Services, and for other purposes.
bills.latest_major_action: Referred to House Energy and Commerce

bills.title: To preserve and protect the free choice of individual employees to form, join, or assist labor organizations, or to refrain from such activities.
bills.committees: House Education and the Workforce Committee
bills.latest_major_action: Referred to the House Committee on Education and the Workforce.

bills.title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to increase the amount excluded from gross income for employer-provided dependent care assistance.
bills.latest_major_action: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

bills.title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to extend the exclusion for employer-provided educational assistance to employer payments of qualified education loans.
bills.latest_major_action: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

bills.title: Permitting the use of the rotunda of the Capitol for a ceremony as part of the commemoration of the days of remembrance of victims of the Holocaust.
bills.latest_major_action: Referred to the House Committee on House Administration.

bills.title: Expressing the sense of Congress that a commemorative postage stamp should be issued in honor of the Buffalo Soldiers.

bills.latest_major_action: Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform.

bills.title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to treat obligations financing professional sports stadiums as private activity bonds if such obligations meet the private business use test.
bills.latest_major_action: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

bills.title: To amend the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 to limit assistance to the Palestinian Authority and the Palestine Liberation Organization, and for other purposes.
bills.latest_major_action: Referred to the House Committee on Foreign Affairs.

bills.title: To amend the Help America Vote Act of 2002 to reauthorize and improve the operation of the Election Assistance Commission, to provide funds to States to make security upgrades to voter registration lists and processes, and for other purposes.
bills.committees: House Science, Space, and Technology Committee
bills.latest_major_action: Referred to House Science, Space, and Technology

bills.title: To establish the Office of Rural Broadband Initiatives within the Department of Agriculture, to preserve open internet requirements, and for other purposes.
bills.latest_major_action: Referred to House Energy and Commerce

bills.title: To amend the National Security Act of 1947 to provide for additional requirements relating to the regular attendees of meetings of the National Security Council and bodies thereof.
bills.latest_major_action: Referred to House Intelligence (Permanent)

bills.title: To amend title 28 of the United States Code to exclude the State of New Jersey from the prohibition on professional and amateur sports gambling to the extent approved by the legislature of the State.
bills.latest_major_action: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.

bills.title: To amend the Help America Vote Act of 2002 to promote early voting in elections for Federal office and to prevent unreasonable waiting times for voters at polling places used in such elections, and for other purposes.
bills.latest_major_action: Referred to the House Committee on House Administration.

bills.title: To amend the National Trails System Act to designate the Route 66 National Historic Trail, and for other purposes.
bills.latest_major_action: Referred to the House Committee on Natural Resources.

bills.title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide equitable treatment for residents of Puerto Rico with respect to the refundable portion of the child tax credit and to provide the same treatment to families in Puerto Rico with one child or two children that is currently provided to island families with three or more children.
bills.latest_major_action: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.
